comment: Dr. Jafeh was by far the best professor I had at KSU. The homework is hard but if you complete it then the test will be easy because it is just easier versions of the same problems.
He's a great teacher. He does expect you to know any from previous classes. He is very helpful during office hours. Talk to him immediately if you have problems he walks you through the issue.

If you like vague explainations, writing tons of notes, studying for hours, and have most of what you wrote and studied to not show up on your tests, then this is the professor for you! This guy just gives practice problems as an answer if you are confused on something.  Cool guy but horrible teacher!! Do not take unless you have outside help!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Be prepared to work hard for this grade, this is not the easiest of classes no matter the professor. Stay on top of the material so you can do well on all the quizzes, about 10 of them, and you can be sure to make a decent grade. There are lots of extra points, about 30, on each exam to make up for errors or poor quiz grades.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Aim to do well on all the pop quizzes, which are about every other class. Your grade on the quizzes will be a good reflection of your overall grade for the course. So be prepared for quizzes every class and you will breeze through. He does offer a lot of extra points on each exam to make up for errors and quiz grades. You will need to work hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr J is the best professor I've had in college so far. His name is foreign, and sometimes it takes him a second to think of the right word to say, but he's very easy to understand. If you have a question, ask it. He will go over a problem until you understand it. Test questions come straight from HW. He grades tests out of 130-140 so lots of extra
Puts material covered in class on the tests, so you need to be there taking notes. Gives a lot of optional extra credit on tests. Pop quizzes all the time, stay on top of the material!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great Professor overall. Will go through questions asked by students, and goes through step by step. This is one class i do not want to skip.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: He's a cool guy however his assessments are very difficult.  Pop quizzes make up 25% of your grade, 75% split up into three tests. Math has always came easy to me and still is. Differential equations isn't hard however he really makes his problems and test much more difficult than they need to be. If your up for challenges I would still pick somone
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Farzan is a difficult but very good. Hilarious and easy to follow. He writes everything out step by step. 3 tests, and lowest grade is replaced by the final exam grade. Lots of pop quizzes though, at least one every class (at least during the summer session). He genuinely cares about his students & will even personally call you if you need it.
Makes it easy to get an A. So many extra points on exams. Got a C or B on all of the home works and still got an A in the class

He is always available to help during office hours. His homework assignments prepare you for the exam. Sometimes the questions on the HW are challenging but If you show up to class, do the homework and assigned questions you will make an A. A lot of extra credit available on both homework and exams (sometimes up to 40 points).

Dr. Farzan is the man. His humor and attitude makes the lectures easy to follow. Show up to class and take notes. 4 homework and 4 exams; examples from lecture and homework problems show up on exams. Lots of extra cred to be had. Compared to other upper maths, his class is easier. As stated, do the homework and show up, you will do fine on tests.
